info.description:
## Accelerating financial innovation through data #5thGenFintech
A collection of all Okra API endpoints available to clients

For more info checkout the main API docs her => https://docs.okra.ng/docs/api-overview

BASEURL(Production) => https://api.okra.ng/v2/
BASEURL(Sandbox) => https://api.okra.ng/v2/sandbox

post.description:
API endpoint to *Fetch Identities*

The /products/identities endpoint allows you to retrieve various account holder information on file with the bank, including names, emails, phone numbers, and addresses.

Note: This request may take some time to complete if identity was not specified as an initial product when creating the Record. This is because Okra must communicate directly with the institution to retrieve the data.

> A successful request will return a *HTTP 200*  status code

post.description:
## Overview
Okra Spending Patterns product uses state-of-the-art NLP and NLU techniques to understand transactions and classify them into 19 different categories including gambling, food, medical, utilities, travel, and gifts. It aggregates all user debit transactions, predicts the spending category, and calculates the spent amount, the spent percentage, and the number of times each category occurred.
Therefore, this endpoint will enable you get the spending pattern of a customer.

> A successful request will return a *HTTP 200*  status code

Access-Control-Allow-Methods.default: GET, POST, OPTIONS, PUT, PATCH, DELETE

post.description:
## Overview
This endpoint processes liabilities for a customer

The API route works by taking a users transactions then process the transaction description. Next, the processed text is passed through a model to extract transactions related to retail loans (claims and payments), rents and mortgages.
The extracted transactions are analysed to produce the following information:

* `confidence`: how confident the model is for the prediction
* `mortgage`: extracted insights from extracted mortgage transactions
* `institution_name`: name of mortgage institution
* `average_payment_interval`: average days between payments
* `first_payment_date`: date of first mortgage payment
* `last_payment_date`: date of last mortgage payment
* `next_payment_due_date`: the expected due date for next mortgage payment
* `last_payment_amount`: amount for last mortgage payment
* `next_payment_amount`: the expected amount for next mortgage payment
* `no_payments`: total number of mortgage payments
* `total_amount`: total amount of mortgage payments
* `transactions`: list of mortgage transactions
* `ytd_paid`: year to date amount paid
* `rent`: insights from extracted rent transactions
* `beneficiary_name`: name of transaction beneficiary
* `average_payment_interval`: average days between payments
* `first_payment_date`: date of first rent payment
* `last_payment_date`: date of last rent payment
* `last_payment_month`: month of last rent payment
* `no_payments`: total number of rent payments
* `total_amount`: total amount of rent payments
* `transactions`: list of rent transactions
* `years`: list of rent years
* `retail_loans`: list of insights generated from retail loan transactions grouped.

post.description:
## Overview

The API route tries to flag users who display suspicious behaviour when using OKRA's products. It takes  into account a user's profile details and record history. The API response is explained below:

* `confidence`: how confident is the model
* `anomaly_score`: the computed anomaly score. The lower, the more abnormal.
*`prediction`: the prediction label. Values are either ABUSE or NORMAL.
* `sample_score`: the computed normality score. The lower, the more abnormal.
* `explain`: explanation of factors affecting the anomaly prediction

Access-Control-Allow-Methods.default: GET, POST, OPTIONS, PUT, PATCH, DELETE

post.description:
## Overview

The API route works by taking a users transactions then process the transaction description. Next, the processed text is passed through a model to extract transactions related to investments.
The extracted transactions are analysed to produce the following information:

* `confidence`: how confident the model is for the prediction
* `investments`: extracted insights from extracted investment transactions
* `first_deposit_date`: date of first deposit
* `last_deposit_date`: date of last deposit
* `first_returns_date`: date of first roi payment
* `last_returns_date`: date of last roi payment
* `total_returns_received`: total amount of roi
* `total_deposits`: total amount of investment deposits
* `no_returns_received`: total number of roi payments
* `no_deposits`: total number of payments
* `deposits`: list of deposit transactions
* `returns`: list of roi transactions

post.description:
## Overview


The API route works by taking a users transactions then process the transaction description. Next, the processed text is passed through a model to extract transactions related to insurance (claims and payments). The extracted transactions are analysed to produce the following information:
* `claims`: transactions paid to the customer from the insurance company
* `first_claim_date`: date of first claim payment
* `first_payment_date`: date of first premium payment
* `last_claim_date` : date of last claim payment
* `last_payment_date`: date of last premium payment
* `Payments`: transactions paid to the insurance company from customer (premiums)Get Insurance for a customer

post.description:
## What is Micro-Lending 
Its a discount we give to customers for loans less that 20k (or a customer value we approve for them)

## How does it work?
The prerequisite for accessing Micro-lending includes;

- You must hit micro-lending endpoint(`https://api.okra.ng/v2/services/micro-lending/process`) with the following payload `{amount: AMOUNT OF LOAN, record_id: ID OF ORIGINAL RECORD}` to receive the discount
- You must also have to make a postpaid call(not billed immediately).
- The timeline for hitting the endpoint is about 1 Hour, otherwise you'd billed the full cost of the api.
- About Billing;
   * You're charged at the end of the month.
   * At the end of each month we will reconcile the accounts with the amount in your wallets and they will be billed for any mismatched.

## **Note** 

If you dont hit the URL above within 30min the receipt will move from postpaid and you will get charged.

tags.name: Liabilities
tags.description:
The API route works by taking a users transactions then process the transaction description. Next, the processed text is passed through a model to extract transactions related to retail loans (claims and payments), rents and mortgages.
The extracted transactions are analysed to produce the following information:

* `confidence`: how confident the model is for the prediction
* `mortgage`: extracted insights from extracted mortgage transactions
* `institution_name`: name of mortgage institution
* `average_payment_interval`: average days between payments
* `first_payment_date`: date of first mortgage payment
* `last_payment_date`: date of last mortgage payment
* `next_payment_due_date`: the expected due date for next mortgage payment
* `last_payment_amount`: amount for last mortgage payment
* `next_payment_amount`: the expected amount for next mortgage payment
* `no_payments`: total number of mortgage payments
* `total_amount`: total amount of mortgage payments
* `transactions`: list of mortgage transactions
* `ytd_paid`: year to date amount paid
* `rent`: insights from extracted rent transactions
* `beneficiary_name`: name of transaction beneficiary
* `average_payment_interval`: average days between payments
* `first_payment_date`: date of first rent payment
* `last_payment_date`: date of last rent payment
* `last_payment_month`: month of last rent payment
* `no_payments`: total number of rent payments
* `total_amount`: total amount of rent payments
* `transactions`: list of rent transactions
* `years`: list of rent years
* `retail_loans`: list of insights generated from retail loan transactions grouped by
